benchmark_details.name: Language ID in the Wild: Unexpected Challenges on the Path to a Thousand-Language Web Text Corpus
benchmark_details.overview: This paper demonstrates the challenges of language identification (LangID) when generating web text corpora across numerous languages. It highlights the inaccuracies of current LangID methods when applied to real-world data and proposes new evaluation techniques to generate a more robust and cleaner web text corpus in over 600 languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create accurate and robust multilingual web text corpora for enhancing language technology applications in low-resource languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The effectiveness of the generated dataset may vary based on the specific characteristics of individual languages.

data.source: Comprehensive web crawl across various languages using automated language identification models and data filtering techniques.
data.annotation: Human-judged evaluations for precision and recall, automated filtering using curated wordlists.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from the proportion of in-language sentences to total sentences evaluated.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision indicates a cleaner dataset, while recall measures the coverage of the original languages in the crawl.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial precision of generated corpora at 5%, improved to 71.2% using proposed filtering techniques.
methodology.validation: Validation through human evaluation and comparison against other public datasets.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of lower-resource language representation in dataset.
harm: Including disallowed data from misclassified languages in corpus.
